topic.title: Insight Remote Support Service Events
topic.keywords: event logs Insight Remote Support service events log files service events Insight Remote Support

content.p: Use the Remote Support Service Events page to monitor service events, send test events, or set maintenance mode.

A service event is a hardware failure, for example, a problem with an enclosure power supply module or enclosure fan module. When the BladeSystem Enclosure is registered with Insight Remote Support, service events are logged and sent to HP. When HP receives a service event, a support case is opened and details are displayed in the Service Event Log.

td.p: NOTE: To receive email alerts about system events, configure AlertMail on the Enclosure Information>Enclosure Settings>AlertMail page.

content.p: Use Maintenance Mode when performing maintenance on a system. During this time, if a service event is generated, the event will indicate that the system is in maintenance mode. This service event helps HP to determine whether to open a service case. If maintenance mode is not turned off by the user explicitly during this time, it is turned off automatically by Onboard Administrator after the selected amount of time has passed.

ol.li: Select the Enable Maintenance Mode check box.
Select a time in the Expires in menu.

content.p: Maintenance mode ends automatically when the selected amount of time has passed.

td.p: TIP: To end maintenance mode early, clear the Enable Maintenance Mode check box, and then click Apply.

content.p: To verify that your Insight Remote Support configuration is correct, click Send Test Event to send a test event.
When the transmission is finished, the test event is listed in the Service Event Log.
The Service Event Log displays the following details for each service event.

td.p: A unique string that identifies the service event
The time the service event was generated
Each event is classified with a type of either System or Test
A string that identifies the source of the event. Possible values are Fan, Power Supply, Onboard Administrator, Interconnect, or Enclosure.
A string that provides the serial number of the device that generated the event.
The bay number of the device that generated the event.
A string that indicates the severity of the event. The possible values are Critical Error, Degraded, or Informational.
The status of the event submission. Possible values are OK or ERROR.

content.p: To clear the Service Event Log, click Clear Event Log.
